description.narrative: The project aims at strengthening the rights of the IDP's, returnees and the targeted communities in the Lunda Sul and Moxico provinces in eastern Angola.Angola's 27-year civil war destroyed the political and community structures in the rural areas in part icular and left 1.8 million people as refugees. The peace agreement in 2002 led to repatriation and reconstruction, but the war-torn areas are still highly under-developed.The project areas are among the poorest in the country and their biggest challenges are land mines, organization of repatriation, low financial and human capabilities, lack of infrastructure and basic services, as well as the lack of administrative structures in remote areas. By empowering the targeted communities the project aims at incr easing the capacity of communities to promote human rights and to advocate for increased access to social services. As a result of the project the targeted residents are trained, their skills have been developed and basic services improved. The communities have been empowered.The beneficiaries of the project are the residents of the Lunda Sul and Moxico provinces.The project is implemented by the Lutheran World Federation Angola Program, which has over 25 years of experience in disaster relief and repatriat ion of refugees and returnees, especially in Lunda Sul and Moxico states in eastern Angola.
